page.title: 17Norton Fitzwarren School
page.content: Norton Fitzwarren Primary School was built in 1872. We were told by the headmaster that in 1948 there was going to be a new school built but nothing was done about it. Children start at the age of 4 and they are looked after by a total of 13 full- and part-time staff. The children enjoy Science, Craft, and P.E. and they like sport although they say that they do not have enough. There are between 70 and 80 pupils. The school has an outdoor swimming pool which the children like to use. At the age of 11, children leave the school and go to such secondary schools as Ladymead, Bishop Fox's and Priorswood. Most children go to Ladymead. Occasionally some children go to private schools such as Taunton School, King's, and Queen's Colleges.
